title: Peter Crouch lifts the lid on partying with Wayne Rooney and doing the robot with Mickey Rourke
text:

Peter Crouch has explained why he would pick Wayne Rooney over David Beckham for a night out partying.

And the Premier League legend has also revealed the time he had a big drinking session with Hollywood star Mickey Rourke - a chance meeting that ultimately ended in the pair doing the iconic 'robot' dance.

Retired striker Crouch enjoyed a glittering career in the Premier League which took in spells with the likes of Liverpool and Tottenham , while he also became an integral part of the England set-up and deservedly earned 42 caps.

It was his Three Lions spell that allowed him to play alongside Rooney and Beckham, with Crouch enjoying a string of memorable nights with the global superstars.

(Image: Getty Images Sport)

(Image: PA Archive/PA Images)

And writing in his latest book I, Robot: How To Be A Footballer 2 , Crouch has lifted the lid on the pair.

As reported by The Sun , he said: “I wouldn’t pick Becks for a night out because he’d bring too much attention. But Wayne would be up there. He’s a good laugh on a night out.”

Crouch is regarded as one of the finest strikers of his generation, having scored over 100 top-flight goals and also boasting an impressive international record of 22 goals in 42 games.

During his career, which he called time on this year, he became known for busting out his trademark 'robot' dance when celebrating a goal.

(Image: Publicity Picture)

And the 38-year-old has opened up on how American icon Rourke once spotted him during a holiday in Miami, Florida.

He explained: “I was going through a nightclub where there was a fella who looked like Mickey Rourke. This fella said to me, ‘You’re Robot Boy’.

“It WAS Mickey Rourke and we both started doing the robot dance. It ended up being a 4am-in-the-morning job.

“‘Tomorrow,’ he said, ‘let’s do it again’. So we had another great night out with him. At 9am the next day, there was a knock on the door. I looked through the spyhole and it’s Mickey Rourke.”
